discourse_list.title: [Signal Request] Advance "Rapid Payment for Small Bug Bounties" to on-chain poll

content.content: Context:     MIP4c2-SPXX: Rapid Payment for Small Bug Bounties (MIP64, MIP40c3-SP42 Amendment) RFC   MIP4c2-SPXX: Rapid Payment for Small Bug Bounties (MIP64, MIP40c3-SP42 Amendment)  Preamble MIP4c3-SP#: XX MIP to be amended: MIP64, MIP40c3-SP42 Author(s): @psychonaut Contributors: @travinimmunefi Tags: mip-amendment Status: RFC Date of Amendment Submission: 2022-01-26 Date of ratification: <yyyy-mm-dd>   Specification  Motivation The current bug bounty payment process is adequate for large payouts, but inconvenient for small payouts. This MIP adds a small payout process.   Small payouts can …      Pros:  Successful small bug bounty submissions can get paid promptly instead of waiting as long as one month   Cons:  The protocol must advance 100k DAI to ISCU that may not be spent, decreasing the surplus buffer by the same amount Slightly more work for ISCU in comparison to batching everything up     Advance “Rapid Payment for Small Bug Bounties” to on-chain poll  Yes No Abstain     0 voters     This poll will close in one week on 2022-02-11T07:59:00Z. If Yes obtains more support than No then the question will advanced to an on-chain poll.
content.GPT-summary: The post is an explanation of a proposal for a new MIP that aims to improve the bug bounty payment process for small payouts. The author provides the motivation, pros, and cons of the proposal. The post also includes a poll asking for support to advance the proposal to an on-chain poll. Some third parties are giving constructive criticism, asking questions, and auditing the proposal.

content.content: I think it is essential to armor and secure ourselves in the first place. I didn’t know that we had to wait a month, it seems to me a big security breach.

content.content: You are right, incentives need to be focused to preserve the security of the protocol.
A few more days left to vote and we have very little participation here. Please consider voting in this Signal to facilitate the governance process.
Just out of curiosity, when in the future you wish to launch a similar signal, how much is the minimum number of votes needed to be taken into account?

content.content: Since the originating proposal is now a MIP4c2 subproposal, this Signal Request will have no effect.
This topic was automatically closed 30 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
